metadata.titel_preek: The Father Who Does Not Devour

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God the Father, rather than demanding the destruction of the human subject to appease wrath, takes the judgment upon Himself in the person of the Son to heal and restore the human receiver.

tekstueel_bewijs: The Lord has laid on him the iniquity of us all.
He has himself become the human sacrifice.
He has gone into the water with the snakes himself.
The chastisement that made us whole
With his stripes we are healed

zender.identificatie: God the Father (as the source of Love/Mercy)
tekstueel_bewijs: The unconditional love of the father won the battle
To deliver us from everlasting condemnation
Gives his own body and blood to be heavenly food for us
The incarnate Lord gives his own body and blood

tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just bad habits but the 'cavernous mouth' of death and the ontological weight of iniquity.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human response of repentance and conversion following the experience of grace.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer/Franklin Graham
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The primary program (God's grace) creates the 'space' for the secondary program (human response). Mercy evokes repentance.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: The Son → God the Father ← Sin/Judgment

voorbeelden_god_subject: The Lord has laid on him the iniquity of us all.
He has himself become the human sacrifice.
He has gone into the water with the snakes himself.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We have left undone those things...

voorbeelden: Things that we ought to have done
The struggle to believe that one is good enough
The Christian church knows what to do about this fear
The space of grace that had been opened for him enabled him to understand
He has come under his own judgment in order to deliver us

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on God's 'Pouvoir' (Power/Ability) to save where man is 'incompetent' (no health in us). Grace provides the competence.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Starts at S2 (Neptune), moves to ~S1 (the fear of the judge), then reveals S1 (The Father) by showing God taking S2 (Judgment) onto Himself.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: God resolves the tension by becoming the victim of His own judgment, transforming the 'Devourer' into 'Food'.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; the 'snakes' and 'cavernous mouth' are presented as terrifyingly real to the human psyche.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is rigorously theocentric. God is the subject of the salvific verbs, and human action is explicitly framed as a response to prior divine initiative.

indicatoren_moralisme.indicator: Potential Exemplarism in Franklin Graham story
indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Franklin Graham underwent a conversion experience

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: He has not required human sacrifice; he has himself become the human sacrifice.
Mercy evoked repentance, not the other way around.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Franklin Graham is used not as a model of 'how to convert' but as a receiver of a father's grace.
bijbelse_figuren_als_model: Isaiah's Servant (as God's act, not man's example)

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief from the 'fear of not measuring up'; psychological liberation.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic grace; God's action is the sole cause of the new state.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the myth of Neptune to the reality of the Gospel is structurally seamless.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: He has come under his own judgment in order to deliver us.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon attributes the 'Pouvoir' to the Father/Son directly.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully positions God as the Subject and the hearer as the Receiver of a finished work.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain current balance as it serves the specific goal of comfort.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Could slightly increase 'Savoir-faire' regarding how this grace manifests in the neighbor-oriented secondary program.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in Rutledge's 'Grammar of Grace'. The reversal of the 'Devourer' into 'Food' is a profound semiotic move.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorical analysis would focus on the Mozart/Idomeneo illustration; Greimas shows that this illustration is the 'Opponent' structure that the Gospel 'Subject' overcomes.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would focus on the Hebrew of Isaiah 53; Greimas focuses on the functional roles of the 'He' and the 'We' in the text.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the sermon's power comes from a 'Subject-Switch' where God takes the role of the Victim (Object) to remain the Savior (Subject).

appendices.notities: The sermon uses psychological archetypes (the father) to ground the cosmic actantial roles.
